license.description: The license this software is published under.

name.description: Name of the adapter without ioBroker

title.description: Longer name of adapter DEPRECATED: For admin version >= 5 this property is no longer required

titleLang.description: Longer name of adapter in all supported languages like {en: 'Adapter', de: 'adapter', ru: 'Драйвер'}

news.description: Short form of changelog in all supported languages

messagebox.description: true if messagebox supported. Hence, the adapter can receive sendTo messages. Up from controller v5, please use common.supportedMessages.custom = true

blockedVersions.description: Array which lists all blocked versions. Blocked versions will not be started. Use semver notation to specify the version ranges. The information is always used from the io-package.json in the GitHub repository.

supportedMessages.description: Object which defines, if the adapter supports receiving messages via sendTo. Additionally, it defines if specific messages are supported.

custom.description: If custom messages are supported (same as legacy messagebox)

deviceManager.description: If adapter supports the device manager and thus responds to the corresponding messages

notifications.description: If notification handling is supported, for information, see https://github.com/foxriver76/ioBroker.notification-manager#requirements-for-messaging-adapters

stopInstance.description: If adapter supports signal stopInstance. Use number if you need more than 1000 ms for stop routine. The signal will be sent before stop to the adapter. (used if problems occurred with SIGTERM). (Same as legacy `supportStopInstance`)

getHistory.description: If adapter supports getHistory message. (Same as legacy `getHistory`, to avoid problems, set both flags in parallel for now)

custom.description: UI type of custom tab inside admin UI

config.description: UI type of config page inside admin UI

tab.description: UI type of tab inside admin UI

automaticUpgrade.description: Automatically upgrade the adapter in the configured semver range. Best practice is to leave this as none and let the user opt-in.

docs.description: The structure like {"en": "docs/en/README.md", "de": ["docs/de/README.md", "docs/de/README1.md"]} that describes the documentation if not in README.md

license.description: DEPRECATED: Use 'common.licenseInformation' instead, move the current 'common.license' attribute to package.json instead!

type.description: Use 'paid' for adapters which do not work without a paid license. Use 'commercial' for adapters which require a license for commercial use only. Use 'limited' if some functionalities are not available without a paid license.

link.description: Hyperlink, where information about the license can be found. For non-free licenses the linked page should contain information about free features (if applicable), time of validity, link to shop and seller information. This is required if the license type is different from 'free'. For 'free' licenses an optional link to the license file can be placed here.

install.description: The adapter will be executed once additionally after installation and the `install` event will be emitted during this run. This allows for executing one time installation code.

unsafePerm.description: if the package must be installed with "npm --unsafe-perm" parameter

adminColumns.description: Custom attributes, that must be shown in admin in the object browser. Like: [{"name": {"en": "KNX address"}, "path": "native.address", "width": 100, "align": "left"}, {"name": "DPT", "path": "native.dpt", "width": 100, "align": "right", "type": "number", "edit": true, "objTypes": ["state", "channel"]}]. type is a type of the attribute (e.g. string, number, boolean) and only needed if edit is enabled. objTypes is a list of the object types, that could have such attribute. Used only in edit mode too.

adminTab.description: Adds a Tab which can be shown in admin adapter

ignoreConfigUpdate.description: Do not update config TAB if configuration changed (to enable configure settings in TAB)

link.description: Link for iframe in the TAB. You can use parameters replacement like this: "https://%ip%:%port%". IP will be replaced with host IP. "port" will be extracted from native.port.

name.description: Name of TAB (multilingual object) in admin

singleton.description: If true, only one TAB for all instances will be shown.

allowInit.description: allow for "scheduled" adapter to be called "not in the time schedule", if settings changed or adapter started. Or allow scheduled adapter start once after configuration changed and then by schedule.

availableModes.description: values for common.mode if more than one mode is possible

blockly.description: if adapter has custom blocks for blockly (admin/blockly.js required)

dataFolder.description: Folder relative to iobroker-data where the adapter stores the data. This folder will be backed up and restored automatically. You can use variable '%INSTANCE%' in it

dataSource.description: How the data will be received from device

dependencies.description: Array like [{"js-controller": ">=2.0.0"}] that describes which ioBroker modules are required for this adapter on the same host

enabled.description: Value should be false so new instances are disabled by default

eraseOnUpload.description: erase all previous data in the directory before upload

extIcon.description: Link to external icon for uninstalled adapters. Normally on GitHub

getHistory.description: if adapter supports getHistory message. (Up from controller v5, please use `common.supportedMessages.getHistory`)

globalDependencies.description: Array like [{"admin": ">=2.0.0"}] that describes which ioBroker modules are required for this adapter on one of the hosts

icon.description: name of the local icon (should be located in subdirectory "admin")

keywords.description: Similar to keywords in package.json, but can be defined in many languages.

localLinks.description: Link to the web service of this adapter. E.g {"_default": "http://localhost:5984/_utils"} for button in admin

anyOf.deprecationMessage: Please structure {link, color, pro, cloud, intro, icon, name, order} instead of string

link.description: Link to the web service of this adapter, like: %web_protocol%://%ip%:%web_port%/vis-2/edit.html

anyOf.deprecationMessage: Please use link template as string instead of boolean

anyOf.description: Link to the adapter, like: vis-2/index.html according to "https://iobroker.pro/"

cloud.description: Link to the adapter, like: vis-2/index.html according to "https://iobroker.net/"

intro.description: Should be this link be shown on intro tab in admin

name.description: Name of the link. Could be multi-language

order.description: Used on "intro" and cloud tabs to sort the links

logTransporter.description: If this adapter receives logs from other hosts and adapters (e.g. to store them somewhere)

main.description: Name of the start file. DEPRECATED: For controller >= 3.3 please use package.json main.

materialize.description: If adapter supports > admin3 (materialize style) DEPRECATED: For admin version >= 5 please use the property 'adminUI'

materializeTab.description: If adapter supports > admin3 for tab (materialize style) DEPRECATED: For admin version >= 5 please use the property 'adminUI'

noConfig.description: Do not show configuration dialog for instance DEPRECATED: For admin version >= 5 please use adminUI.config = "none"

noIntro.description: never show instances of this adapter on Intro/Overview screen in admin (like icons, widgets)

noRepository.description: If adapter delivered with initial installation or has own repository

nogit.description: If true, no install from github directly is possible

nondeletable.description: This adapter cannot be deleted or updated. It will be updated together with controller.

onlyWWW.description: Say to controller, that adapter has only html files and no main.js, like rickshaw

osDependencies.description: OS packages which should be installed on adapter installation

os.description: String or array of supported operation systems, e.g ["linux", "darwin"]

preserveSettings.description: String (or array) with names of attributes in common of instance, which will not be deleted. E.g. "history", so by setState('system.adapter.mqtt.0", {..}) the field common.history will not be deleted even if new object does not have this field. To delete the attribute it must be explicitly done with common:{history: null}.

restartAdapters.description: Array with names of adapter that must be restarted after this adapter is installed, e.g. ["vis"]

restartSchedule.description: CRON schedule to restart mode daemon adapters

schedule.description: CRON schedule if adapter runs in mode schedule

serviceStates.description: If adapter can deliver additional states. If true, the path adapter/lib/states.js (or given path as string) will be called and it give following parameters function (objects, states, instance, config, callback). The function must deliver the array of points with values like function (err, result) { result = [{id: 'id1', val: 1}, {id: 'id2', val: 2}]}

singletonHost.description: Adapter can be installed only once on one host

singleton.description: Adapter can be installed only once in whole system

stopBeforeUpdate.description: If adapter must be stopped before update

stopTimeout.description: timeout in ms to wait, till adapter shut down

subscribable.description: Variables of this adapter must be subscribed with sendTo to enable updates

supportCustoms.description: If the adapter support settings for every state. It has to have custom.html file in admin. Sample can be found in ioBroker.history

supportStopInstance.description: If adapter supports signal stopInstance (messagebox required). Use number if you need more than 1000 ms for stop routine. The signal will be sent before stop to the adapter. (used if problems occurred with SIGTERM). (Up from controller v5, please use `common.supportedMessages.stopInstance`)

visWidgets.description: Overview of vis 2 widgets provided by the adapter, define the name of the provided sets as keys

.+.description: The key represents the name of a provided widget set

anyOf.description: Translations will be loaded from visWidgets.<SET_NAME>.url and i18n/<LANG>.json
Translations will be loaded from customComponent.js with name ./translations

url.description: Relative path ('http://ip:port/vis/widgets/' + url) or full url to load component from

components.description: Names of widgets which have to be shown, normally equal to the content of 'modulefederation.config.js'

ignoreInVersions.description: The vis widget does not support the listed major versions of vis

webByVersion.description: Show version as prefix in web adapter (usually - ip:port/material, webByVersion - ip:port/1.2.3/material)

webExtendable.description: If web server in this adapter can be extended with plugin/extensions like proxy, simple-api

webExtension.description: Relative filename to connect the web extension. E.g. in simple-api "lib/simpleapi.js" relative to the adapter root directory. Additionally is native.webInstance required to say where this extension will be included. Empty means, it must run as own web service. "*" means every web server must include it.

webPreSettings.description: Object of parameters that must be included into info.js by webServer adapter. (Example material)

webservers.description: Array of web server's instances that should serve content from the adapters www folder

welcomeScreen.description: Array of pages, that should be shown on the "web" index.html page. ["vis/edit.html", "vis/index.html"] or [{"link": "vis/edit.html", "name": "Vis editor", "img": "vis/img/edit.png", "color": "blue"}, "vis/index.html"]

welcomeScreenPro.description: Array of pages used on access via ioBroker cloud, that should be shown on the "web" index.html page. ["vis/edit.html", "vis/index.html"] or [{"link": "vis/edit.html", "name": "Vis editor", "img": "vis/img/edit.png", "color": "blue"}, "vis/index.html"]

wwwDontUpload.description: Do not upload the www directory into DB. Used only for admin.

tier.description: Lower tiers are started before higher tiers instances, TIER 1: LOGIC, TIER 2: APIs & other data, TIER 3: not fastly needed data, like BackItUp, Visualization, etc.

messages.description: Messages can be shown on adapter installation, update and instance creation

condition.description: Message will only be shown if condition matches

rules.description: Rules which need to be true, e.g. ["oldVersion<2.0.0", "newVersion>=2.0.0"]

link.description: You can define a hyperlink, which will be shown, define its text with `linkText`

linkText.description: If a link is defined and should be embedded in text, you can define the text here

buttons.description: Predefined buttons of the message window

objects.description: Objects which will be created for the adapter

instanceObjects.description: Objects which will be created for each instance

notifications.description: Register notifications for the built-in notification system

name.description: Name which will be shown to the user

description.description: Description which will be shown to the user

severity.description: `info` will only be shown by admin, while `notify` might also be used by messaging adapters, `alert` ensures both

limit.description: Maximum amount of notifications to collect of this type

native.description: Predefined attributes which are accessible in index_m.html and at runtime via adapter.config.<attribute>, e.g. {"port": 1234, "password": "secret"}

protectedNative.description: Array of config attributes which will only be accessible by the own adapter, e.g. ["password"]

encryptedNative.description: Array of config attributes which will be automatically encrypted when stored via Admin configuration page and automatically decrypted at adapter runtime, e.g. ["password", "token"]
